name: opengist
description: OpenGist is a self-hosted alternative to GitHub Gist. It lets users create and manage code snippets with syntax highlighting, versioning, and a web-based editor.
features: Code Snippets: Create and manage code snippets with syntax highlighting for over 100 programming languages.
Version Control: Track changes to snippets with Git-based versioning and diff visualization.
Web Editor: Edit code directly in the browser with syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and keyboard shortcuts.
Public/Private Gists: Control snippet visibility with public sharing or private access for sensitive code.
Fork and Clone: Fork existing snippets to create variations and clone repositories for local development.
Search Engine: Find snippets quickly using full-text search across code content, titles, and descriptions.
User Management: Support multiple users with individual accounts, profiles, and snippet collections.
API Access: Programmatic access to all functionality through REST APIs for automation and integration.
Embed Support: Embed snippets in external websites and documentation with customizable styling.
Raw File Access: Direct access to raw snippet content for command-line tools and automated processing.
Comment System: Add comments and discussions to snippets for collaboration and code review.
Export Options: Download snippets as files or archives for backup and offline access.
